intro: Fagara subserrata, commonly known as the serrated fagara, is a species of flowering plant in the family Berberidaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges and produces small, clustered white or greenish flowers. Fagara subserrata is often found in lowland forests and is valued for its ornamental qualities. Its botanical features make it an important component of the biodiversity in its native habitats.
